pullRequest.title: Create TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent, Relocate and extend Town(Pre)UnclaimEvents.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description:

This commit does a few major things:


Relocates TownUnclaimEvent (TUE) and TownPreUnclaimEvent (TPUE) to the event.town package.

Original class files remain, but have been marked @deprecated. Usages have been forwarded to new classes.



Creates a WarPreUnclaimEvent TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent (TPUCE) in the war.common.events event.town package.


Introduces a new language key, used by the events for default cancelation messages.


Creates a listener for Flag War that implements the TPUCE event.

Name's not important, it may be renamed post-split, or merged with an existing Flag War listener. Implementation in this PR is for proof-of-concept.




Outstanding Tasks To-Do


 Test against the new event with the TownyCommonListener

Still need to test, I've got my test bench strewn across a desk at the moment.

Requires configuration to match the following for testing:

FlagWar: WAR_ENEMY_PREVENT_INTERACTION_WHILE_FLAGGED [true]
FlagWar: WAR_ENEMY_TIME_TO_WAIT_AFTER_FLAGGED [int; any reasonable value]




Need to probably test in offline mode, or outsource testing to a towny junkie prerelease tester.



 Push a commit with additional Javadoc for the WarPreUnclaimEvent TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent.


 Add language key to other language files.


 Update [VERSION] in deprecation annotations; Bump lang-file version if necessary.

Update either prior to merge, once it's decided if it'll make it in - or LlmDl can update post merge.




New Nodes/Commands/ConfigOptions:

Events:

Modified: TUE and TPUE relocated; added cancelMessage to TPUE
New: Cancellable TPUCE created in event.town package, fired after the /t unclaim [args] command is received before any major unclaiming processing is done.

Language:

Added new key to english.yml: msg_err_town_unclaim_canceled


Relevant Towny Issue ticket:

#4514 Doesn't solve it as originally intended, but gets the job done.
#4511 Allows for tracking PR to be updated and other necessary changes to be reevaluated.


 I have tested this pull request for defects on a server.


By making this pull request, I represent that I have the right to waive copyright and related rights to my contribution, and agree that all copyright and related rights in my contributions are waived, and I acknowledge that the TownyAdvanced organization has the copyright to use and modify my contribution under the Towny License for perpetuity.

nodes.bodyText: On a previous change (maybe neutrality toggling) I put in returns after the event.setCancelled(true), just in case this first statement and the following statement were both true, the 2nd cancellation message would override the first.

beforeCommit.message:
Add a breaking return to TownyCommonListener

Prevent second if from overwriting the first's message.

afterCommit.message:
Re-pkg WarPreUnclaimEvent as TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent in `event.town` pkg.

Makes a bit more sense, when you think about it. It's capable of being called by more than just war plugins, and fragmenting events into separate packages within the same project is insane on it's own.

Added note to class Javadoc about potential confusion with TownyPreUnclaimEvent.

Thanks to @Silverwolfg11 and @LlmDl for discussing this and offering the suggestion.

nodes.bodyText: if it has no valid town it should be nuked still (I don't think townless townblocks are possible anyways nowadays.)

beforeCommit.message:
Bump remaining language files to 0.93

I guess someone forgot to bump them? Adds relevant keys from this PR and https://github.com/TownyAdvanced/Towny/commit/b910e2b9b273d2eaf33ebc9163c57dde1569bc76

afterCommit.message:
Early return to removeTownBlock on catch. Implement Log4j2 I/O

Adds an early return if the TownBlock has no valid town.
Implements Log4J 2, replacing System.out.

nodes.bodyText: This should get an @nullable annotation on it to handle the cases where townless-townblocks are being removed, or alternatively, no event should be fired if the removeTownBlock() method has a null town.

commit.message:
Move `Town(Pre)UnclaimEvent` to the `...events.town` package

- Deprecate at old locations with deprecation messages.
- Add cancellation messages to the TownPreUnclaimEvent
- Add a generic language string.
- Change TownyDatabaseHandler constructor from public to protected. We're in an abstract class, so only other package members can even access this.

In deprecated methods, the [VERSION] will need to be changed post-merge, as I have no idea when that could be.

Create event to catch unclaim commands for war systems

- Creates WarPreUnclaimEvent
  - Cancellable
  - Default message from previous commit.
  - Event runs where FlagWar used to check if the town was under attack, or was attacked recently.
  - Usable by other war systems wishing to hook into it; it makes the town, resident, and TownyWorld available.
  - Accessible through  the war.common package.
- Creates TownyCommonListener in flagwar.listeners
  - Handles the WarPreUnclaimEvent with the previously mentioned executions.
  - May be refactored post-split, but intended to listen to any events in war.common.event package.
- Register TownyCommonListener within FlagWar (as opposed to Towny)

Add a breaking return to TownyCommonListener

Prevent second if from overwriting the first's message.

Re-pkg WarPreUnclaimEvent as TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent in `event.town` pkg.

Makes a bit more sense, when you think about it. It's capable of being called by more than just war plugins, and fragmenting events into separate packages within the same project is insane on it's own.

Added note to class Javadoc about potential confusion with TownyPreUnclaimEvent.

Thanks to @Silverwolfg11 and @LlmDl for discussing this and offering the suggestion.

Add Javadocs to TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent's methods.

Just filling in documentation.

Bump remaining language files to 0.93

I guess someone forgot to bump them? Adds relevant keys from this PR and https://github.com/TownyAdvanced/Towny/commit/b910e2b9b273d2eaf33ebc9163c57dde1569bc76

Early return to removeTownBlock on catch. Implement Log4j2 I/O

Adds an early return if the TownBlock has no valid town.
Implements Log4J 2, replacing System.out.

Annotate Nullable contract for getTown

See [Jetbrains Annotations: Nullable and NotNull](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/nullable-and-notnull-annotations.html#notnull)

commit.message:
Remove a return in TDH#removeTownBlock(); add Nullable to TUE#getTown()

The town is allowed to be null, the TownPreUnclaimCmdEvent simply cancels itself if it is.
